sentences.english: The girl clasped the doll tightly.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘紧紧抱着洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Happy sharing your doll gifts meaning and experience.
sentences.chinese: 分享你的洋娃娃礼物快乐意义和经验。

sentences.english: My granddaughter is as ptty as a little doll.
sentences.chinese: 我孙女像小洋娃娃一样漂亮。

sentences.english: A beautiful doll is hung over the window.
sentences.chinese: 窗上挂着一个漂亮的洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Trouble started when they ran out of dolls.
sentences.chinese: 当洋娃娃卖完的时候麻烦就开始了。

sentences.english: We recommend sponging and powdering your doll once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们建议您的海绵和粉每月一次的洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Kitty deviled her mother for a doll.
sentences.chinese: 基蒂缠着她母亲要个洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Most of Girls loves doll as a gift.
sentences.chinese: 大多数女孩喜欢把洋娃娃作为礼物。

sentences.english: Mommy says I can take my doll.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈说我可以带着自己的洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Seliing Snoopy dolls wasn't good for children.
sentences.chinese: 出售史努比洋娃娃对儿童没有好处。
你3岁的女儿讨厌洋娃娃吗？

sentences.english: Two toothed Ya-ya and Six toothed Laura went out for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 有天，二齿的亚亚和六齿的洋娃娃一起去吃饭。

sentences.english: The doll pivots at the waist and neck.
sentences.chinese: 那洋娃娃的腰和颈可以转动。

sentences.english: Andie hugged her doll tightly to her chest.
sentences.chinese: 安蒂将她的洋娃娃紧抱在胸前。

sentences.english: Suddenly I miss the warmth of my chilhood doll.
sentences.chinese: 我突然想起从前陪我的那个洋娃娃。

sentences.english: Her friend Michelle liked to collect dolls.
sentences.chinese: 她的朋友米歇尔喜欢收藏洋娃娃。

definition: erhua variant of 女孩[nu:3 hai2]
lit. little princess/fig. spoiled girl/female version of 小皇帝[xiao3 huang2 di4]
erhua variant of 男孩[nan2 hai2]
